fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.dipc

Class DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.plugins.dipc.DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginI, PushControlImplementationI, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin
extends AbstractPlugin
implements PushControlImplementationI
    The class DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin implements the server-side of a push control service that allows to start and stop the push of data via a DataOfferedInboundPort (or subclasses thereof).

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-02-16

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean currentlyPushesData(java.lang.String portURI)
      return true if a series of pushes are done on the port.
      void finalise()
      will attempt to stop all pushing tasks that have not been stopped yet, letting currently executing ones finish if they are running at finalisation time.
      void initialise()
      initialise the plug-in by adding to the owner component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in; subclasses should add any other initialisation necessary to make the plug-in work in the context of its owner.
      void installOn(ComponentI owner)
      verify that the owner can schedule tasks, as this facility is used to schedule the pushing tasks (BCM plug-ins are usually not allowed to create their own threads but rather use the ones of their owner component).
      boolean isInitialised()
      return true if the plug-in is fully initialised and ready to execute in the context of its owner component.
      boolean isPortExisting(java.lang.String portURI)
      return true if the owner component has a data offered inbound port of the given URI.
      protected void limitedPushingTask(java.lang.String portURI, long interval, int n)
      execute n data pushes on the given port with an interval of interval milliseconds.
      protected abstract void pushOnPort(java.lang.String portURI)
      push one piece of data on the port which URI is given; component dependent hence must be implemented when creating a specific instance of the plug-in.
      void startLimitedPushing(java.lang.String portURI, long interval, int n)
      start, after interval period of time, n pushes of data and force the pushes to be done each interval period of time.
      void startUnlimitedPushing(java.lang.String portURI, long interval)
      start, after interval period of time, the pushing of data and force the pushes to be done indefinitely each interval period of time.
      void stopPushing(java.lang.String portURI)
      stop the pushing of data on the given port.
      void uninstall()
      uninstall the plug-in from its owner component.

      • installOn

        public void installOn(ComponentI owner)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        verify that the owner can schedule tasks, as this facility is used to schedule the pushing tasks (BCM plug-ins are usually not allowed to create their own threads but rather use the ones of their owner component).

        Contract

         pre    owner != null and owner.canScheduleTasks()
 post   true                            // no more postconditions.
        Specified by:
        installOn in interface PluginI
        Overrides:
        installOn in class AbstractPlugin
        Parameters:
        owner - component to which the plug-in is linked.

      • limitedPushingTask

        protected void limitedPushingTask(java.lang.String portURI,
                                  long interval,
                                  int n)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        execute n data pushes on the given port with an interval of interval milliseconds.

        Contract

         pre    portURI != null and this.isPortExisting(portURI)
 pre    interval > 0 and n >= 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        portURI - URI of the port through which the push is done.
        interval - delay between pushes (in milliseconds).
        n - remaining number of pushes to be done, unless stopped.
